member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.MergeDistanceThreshold
member.summary:
Threshold distance between jump and mark list commands that merged (mm)
Default: 0.001 mm
member.remarks:
Marks or jumps for same positions are cause unexpected poor(likes as burn-in effect) quality.
So supress(or eliminate) jumps for same positions for higher quality.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.JumpModeLimitLength
member.summary:
Jump mode limit length (mm)
Used with RtcJumpMode
Default: 0 mm
member.remarks:
At the end of the 2D jump, a jump-length dependent Jump Delay occurs.
This Jump Delay can be specified for the corresponding jump length by load_jump_table_offset or set_jump_table.
CtlDelay is not taken into account.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Config.DivideArcToLinesDistance
member.summary:
Step distance for divide arc into lines
Default: 0.5 mm

item.description: When draw arc at screen, it will be splitted into lines.
If center of arc is out of range, it will be splitted into lines.
Curve(or spline) are splitted into lines.
DXF ellipse is splitted into lines.
Transformed(like as rotated by matrix) arc is splitted into lines.
Jump and marks are splitted into lines when simulate laser path.
Hatch by polygon are splitted into lines.

F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.PulseSwitchSetting
member.summary:
Pulse Switch Setting (does not apply neither to laser mode 4 nor to laser mode 6).
The setting only affects those laser control signals (more precisely: those LASER1 or LASER2 laser active modulation pulses in CO2 mode or LASER1 Q-Switch pulses in the YAG modes) that are not yet fully processed at completion of the LASERON signal. = 0: The signals are cut off at the end of the LASERON signal. = 1: The final pulse fully executes despite completion of the LASERON signal.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.PhaseShift
member.summary:
Phase shift of the laser control signals (does not apply neither to laser mode 4 nor to laser mode 6).
= 0: No phase shift. = 1: CO2 mode: The LASER1 signal is exchanged with the LASER2 signal. YAG modes: The LASER1 is shifted back 180 (half a signal period)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.DisableLaserActiveSignal
member.summary:
Enabling or disabling of laser control signals for Laser active operation
= 0: The Laser active laser control signals are enabled. = 1: The Laser active laser control signals are disabled (then the laser output ports are in the high impedance tristate mode).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.LaserOnSignalLevelLow
member.summary:
LASERON signal level.
= 0: The signal at the LASERON port is set to active-high. = 1: The signal at the LASERON port is set to active-low.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.Laser12SignalLevelLow
member.summary:
LASER1/LASER2 signal level.
= 0: The signals at the LASER1 and LASER2 output ports are set to active-high. = 1: The signals at the LASER1 and LASER2 output ports are set to active-low.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.ExtPulseSignalRisingEdge
member.summary:
Determines for laser_on_pulses_freq whether external signal pulses (at the LASER connectors DIGITAL IN1 digital input) are to be counted at rising or falling edges:
= 0: At the falling edge. = 1: At the rising edge

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.OutputSynchronization
member.summary:
Output synchronization
= 0: Output synchronization is switched off (default setting). = 1: Output synchronization is switched on

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.ConstantLaserPulseLength
member.summary:
Constant Laser PulseLength
= 0: The constant pulse length mode is switched off (default setting). = 1: The constant pulse length mode is switched on

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit.AutomaticMonitoringToStop
member.summary: = 1: In case of error, automatic monitoring (laser-signal auto-suppression) automatically generates a /STOP signal (list stops, laser control signals get permanently switched off).

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Contains(SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5LaserControlSignal.Bit)
member.summary: Check Bit flag is exist ornot

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStart
member.summary:
External /START
= 1: The external start input (by /START, /START2 or /Slave-START) is enabled. = 0: The external start input is disabled.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStop
member.summary:
External /STOP
= 1: An external list stop (/STOP, /STOP2, /Slave-STOP or simulate_ext_stop) causes explicit cancellation of the external start queues entries (/START, /START2, /Slave-START or simulate_ext_start). = 0: No effect.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.TrackDelay
member.summary:
Track Delay
= 1: The track delay (defined by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list) that postpones execution of the list start relative to the triggering input signal or simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command (see External List Start, page 240) is deactivated. = 0: No effect.To define and activate the track delay (e.g. for Processing-on-the-fly applications), use the command simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStartAgain
member.summary:
External /START Again
= 1: The external start input is not disabled by an external stop request. = 0: The external start input is disabled by an external stop request

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.EncoderReset
member.summary:
Encoder Reset
= 1: Encoder resets of the two internal encoder counters (initiated by the Processing-on-the-fly commands set_fly_x, set_fly_y or set_fly_rot) occur after the subsequent start trigger(i.e.the subsequent external start signal or simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command, possibly postponed by a track delay defined by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list, see also bit #2). = 0: Encoder resets occur immediately with each initiating Processing-on-the-fly command.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5ExternalControlMode.Bit.TrackDelayConfig
member.summary:
Track Delay Config
= 1: Track delay configured by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list is counted beginning with the most recent externally (but not with execute_list_pos etc.) triggered or simulated external list start.The interval between subsequent external list starts (in encoder pulses) is thus constant(see also page 242). For stop_execution or an external stop signal, bit #10 gets reset to 0. This bit has no effect if the firmware version is 506 or lower(see get_rtc_version). = 0: Track delay configured by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list is counted beginning with the time point an external list start was requested(i.e.with the corresponding simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command or external start signal). The interval between subsequent external list starts (in encoder pulses) can thus vary.This is standard for firmware version 506 or lower(see get_rtc_version).

member.summary: Check Bit flag is exist ornot

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.cardId
member.summary: RTC card's identifier no (for multiple cards)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.varPoly
member.summary: 0: Disables Variable Polygon Delays mode. Default setting. 1: Enables Variable Polygon Delays mode.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.directMode3D
member.summary: This parameter effects only 3D-applications. 0: The z output is changed to its end-value in such a way that the focus is kept in one plane during the entire jump. 1: The z output is changed directly (linearly)to its end value during a jump.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.edgeLevel
member.summary: This parameter defines a maximum laser on time for the corners of a Polyline. If the Polygon Delay is longer than or equal to this value (because the angle is close to 180, for instance), the laser is switched off (after a LaserOff Delay) and a new Polyline is started. This can be useful for preventing burn-in effects. The EdgeLevel value must be smaller than twice the set value for the Polygon Delay, otherwise it has no effect

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.minJumpDelay
member.summary: Minimum Jump Delay that cannot be undercut for jumps shorter than JumpLengthLimit(even for jump vectors of zero length, see Figure 40). For jumps longer than JumpLengthLimit, the MinJumpDelay has no relevance. To avoid anomalies in the range of MinJumpDelay, define a value for MinJumpDelay that is not larger than the Jump Delay.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc5.jumpLengthLimit
member.summary: Jump length limit. In bits. JumpLengthLimit > 0 enables the Variable Jump Delays mode. If the jump vector is longer than this value, then the fixed Jump Delay (see set_scanner_delays) is inserted. For all shorter jump lengths, a linearly interpolated Variable Jump Delay (page 136) between MinJumpDelay and the Jump Delay is calculated and inserted, see Figure 40. JumpLengthLimit = 0 disables the Variable Jump Delays mode.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.PulseSwitchSetting
member.summary:
Pulse Switch Setting (does not concern Laser Mode 4 or Laser Mode 6).
The setting only affects those laser control signals (more precisely: those LASER1 or LASER2 laser active modulation pulses in CO2 Mode or LASER1 Q-Switch pulses in the YAG modes) that are not yet fully processed at completion of the LASERON signal. = 0: The signals are cut off at the end of the LASERON signal. = 1: The final pulse fully executes despite completion of the LASERON signal.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.PhaseShift
member.summary:
Phase shift of the laser control signals (does not concern Laser Mode 4 or Laser Mode 6).
= 0: No phase shift. = 1: CO2 Mode: The LASER1 signal is exchanged with the LASER2 signal. YAG modes: The LASER1 is shifted back 180 (half a signal period).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.DisableLaserActiveSignal
member.summary:
Enabling or disabling of laser control signals for Laser active operation.
= 0: The Laser active laser control signals are enabled. = 1: The Laser active laser control signals are disabled (then the laser output ports are in the high impedance tristate mode).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.LaserOnSignalLevelLow
member.summary:
LASERON signal level.
= 0: The signal at the LASERON port is set to active-HIGH. = 1: The signal at the LASERON port is set to active-LOW.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.Laser12SignalLevelLow
member.summary:
LASER1/LASER2 signal level.
= 0: The signals at the LASER1 and LASER2 output ports are set to active-HIGH. = 1: The signals at the LASER1 and LASER2 output ports are set to active-LOW

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.ExtPulseSignalRisingEdge
member.summary:
Determines for laser_on_pulses_list whether external signal pulses (at the LASER connectors DIGITAL IN1 digital input) are to be counted at rising or falling edges:
= 0: At the falling edge. = 1: At the rising edge.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.OutputSynchronization
member.summary:
Output synchronization
= 0: Output synchronization is switched off (default setting). = 1: Output synchronization is switched on.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.ConstantLaserPulseLength
member.summary:
Constant Laser PulseLength
= 0: The constant pulse length mode is switched off (default setting). = 1: The constant pulse length mode is switched on.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.AutomaticMonitoringToStop
member.summary: = 1: In case of error, automatic monitoring (automatic suppression of laser control signals) automatically generates a /STOP signal (list stops, laser control signals get permanently switched off).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit.StopToAllMasterSlave
member.summary: = 1: In case of error according to Bit #28, the stop_execution is forwarded as /Master-STOP

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Contains(SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6LaserControlSignal.Bit)
member.summary: Check Bit flag is exist ornot

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStart
member.summary:
External /START
= 1: The external start input (by /START, /START2 or /Slave-START) is enabled. = 0: The external start input is disabled

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStop
member.summary:
External /STOP
= 1: An external stop (/STOP, /STOP2, /Slave-STOP or simulate_ext_stop) causes explicit cancellation of the external start queues entries (/START, /START2, /Slave-START or simulate_ext_start). = 0: No effect

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.TrackDelay
member.summary:
Track Delay
= 1: The track delay (defined by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list) that postpones execution of the start relative to the triggering input signal or simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command (see Section External Start, page 268) is deactivated. = 0: No effect.To define and activate the track delay (for example, for Processing-on-the-fly applications), use simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.ExternalStartAgain
member.summary:
External /START Again
= 1: The external start input is not disabled by an external stop request. = 0: The external start input is disabled by an external stop request.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.EncoderReset
member.summary:
Encoder Reset
= 1: Encoder resets of the two internal encoder counters occur with an external start signal or simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl, postponed by a track delay defined by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list, see also Bit #2). = 0: Encoder resets occur immediately with each initiating Processing-on-the-fly command.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6ExternalControlMode.Bit.TrackDelayConfig
member.summary:
Track Delay Config
= 1: Track delay configured by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list is counted beginning with the most recent externally (but not with execute_list_pos etc.) triggered or simulated external list start.The interval between subsequent external list starts (in encoder pulses) is thus constant(see also page 242). For stop_execution or an external stop signal, bit #10 gets reset to 0. This bit has no effect if the firmware version is 506 or lower(see get_rtc_version). = 0: Track delay configured by simulate_ext_start, set_ext_start_delay or set_ext_start_delay_list is counted beginning with the time point an external list start was requested(i.e.with the corresponding simulate_ext_start or simulate_ext_start_ctrl command or external start signal). The interval between subsequent external list starts (in encoder pulses) can thus vary.This is standard for firmware version 506 or lower(see get_rtc_version).

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.directMode3D
member.summary: This parameter effects only 3D-applications. 0: The z output is changed to its end-value in such a way that the focus is kept in one plane during the entire jump. 1: The z output is changed directly (linearly)to its end value during a jump.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.edgeLevel
member.summary: This parameter defines a maximum laser on time for the corners of a Polyline. If the Polygon Delay is longer than or equal to this value (because the angle is close to 180, for instance), the laser is switched off (after a LaserOff Delay) and a new Polyline is started. This can be useful for preventing burn-in effects. The EdgeLevel value must be smaller than twice the set value for the Polygon Delay, otherwise it has no effect

For jumps longer than JumpLengthLimit, the MinJumpDelay has no relevance. To avoid anomalies in the range of MinJumpDelay, define a value for MinJumpDelay that is not larger than the Jump Delay.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.Rtc6.jumpLengthLimit
member.summary: Jump length limit. In bits. JumpLengthLimit > 0 enables the Variable Jump Delays mode. If the jump vector is longer than this value, then the fixed Jump Delay (see set_scanner_delays) is inserted. For all shorter jump lengths, a linearly interpolated Variable Jump Delay (page 136) between MinJumpDelay and the Jump Delay is calculated and inserted, see Figure 40. JumpLengthLimit = 0 disables the Variable Jump Delays mode.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.Rtc6SyncAxis.CtlAbort
member.remarks: If IsSoftStop is True, then CtlStop function has called internally. Emergency stop. Immediately turns off the laser. Brings mirrors and positioning stage to a standstill as quickly as possible. Wear may occur with frequent use. Cancels the execution of the current Job uncontrolled and immediately by a direct access to the RTC6 board (Emergency stop)

member.summary: LaserSwitchOffsetTime, Time shift for the laser signals output (usec)

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.MarkConfig.LaserMinOffTime
member.summary:
LaserMinOffTime, Shortest 'Laser Standby' operation duration (usec)
Min: 0.015625usec = 1/64usec

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.MarkConfig.JumpSpeed
member.remarks:
Desired combined jump speed (that is, combined scanner and positioning stage motion) during Job execution.
In StageOnly mode,
this speed is strictly adhered to as maximum speed, otherwise the value may be slightly exceeded temporarily.
As of V1.5.0, the following applies:
In operation mode StageOnly, this speed is strictly adhered to as the maximum speed.
In operation mode ScannerOnly and ScannerAndStage, the value can even be temporarily exceeded slightly.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.MarkConfig.MarkSpeed
member.remarks:
The highest desired combined marking speed(that is, combined scanner and positioning stage motion) during Job execution.
There may be cases with blending curves at corner points where the syncAXIS control instance must apply a lower speed.
Then at least the value of MinimalMarkSpeed is used.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.MarkConfig.MinimalMarkSpeed
member.remarks:
The lowest desired spot velocity that shall be reached in corners of the contour.
With blending curves at corner points in order to make rounded edges possible the syncAXIS control instance is allowed to slow down to this speed.
See MarkSpeed.
If a exact defined corner blending cannot be performed with the known scanner and positioning stage dynamics with at least this minimal marking speed, a Sky Writing-like motion is executed.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.GeometryConfig.MaxBlendRadius
member.summary:
Max blend radius (mm)
Important: For BlendMode = slsc_BlendModes_MinimalBlending, the MaxBlendRadius value is used as the limit for the blending curve start.
member.remarks:
Radius of the circle around the corner point(between two vectors) in which the blending curve is to be positioned.
In the marking result, blending curves are also limited by the vector length: Ractual = min(R, l/2).
If the values specified with MaxBlendRadius and/or ApproxBlendLimit cannot be adhered to,
then the syncAXIS control instance executes a jump(similar but different as with RTC-Sky Writing).

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.GeometryConfig.ApproxBlendLimit
member.remarks:
Maximum tolerable mathematical distance of the blending curve to the corner point.
If the values specified with MaxBlendRadius and/or ApproxBlendLimit cannot be adhered to, then the syncAXIS control instance executes a jump (similar but different as with RTC-Sky Writing).

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.GeometryConfig.VectorResolution
member.remarks:
If the target points of two consecutive Mark functions (slsc_list_mark_abs, slsc_list_multi_para_mark_abs, slsc_list_para_mark_abs) have a smaller distance than the VectorResolution value, then these target points are regarded by the syncAXIS control instance as identical.
That is, with Mark vector Mark vector sequences, target points are dismissed under certain circumstances.
The intended use of VectorResolution is as follows: users shall be able to specify target points with a certain input inaccuracy (for example, with floating points or, if data is automatically read-in).
Therefore, reasonable values are in the micrometer range, for example 0.02 mm.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.IRtcSyncAxis.IsSoftStop
member.summary: Is enabled soft stop when aborting CtlAbort
member.remarks:
True =
Cancels the execution of the current Job controlled and inserts a compensation movement for deceleration.
After the slsc_ctrl_stop_controlled call the RTC6 board is still processing already loaded RTC6 micro vector commands in its list memory.
Therefore, it may take up to 30 s until the actual Job execution end.Afterwards the compensation movement for deceleration is executed.During this entire time, slsc_ctrl_get_exec_state returns slsc_ExecState_Executing.
After the compensation movement, the syncAXIS control instance operation status changes to red. The syncAXIS control instance must be initialized again.
False =
Cancels the execution of the current Job uncontrolled and immediately by a direct access to the RTC6 board. (Emergency stop)

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.IRtcSyncAxis.BandWidth
member.summary:
BandWidth (Hz)
Higher value: Increase work load at stage.
Lower value: Increase work load at scanner.
Lower than 0.23 are not allowed.
member.remarks:
Otherwise, the return value indicates that Bit #06 is set (UnplausibleOrUnknownParameter).
Typical values are between 13 Hz, depending on the scan head working field and the dynamic range of the positioning stage.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.IRtcSyncAxis.HeuristicIndex
member.remarks:
Determines the spatial extent of each Segment = distance between starting point and end point (exception: diameter of the circle with circular Segments ([*] arc[*], [*] circle[*]) which sweep more than a semicircle).
Checks the characteristic(= DynamicReductionFunction) if there is a corresponding Velocity value for the result from(1) (= Length value).
Only if the Velocity value from(2) is smaller than the original marking speed: the Heuristic reduces the marking speed of the Segment to this Velocity value.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SyncAxis.IRtcSyncAxis.CtlStop
member.summary:
Stop list executing (soft stop)
With compensation movement for deceleration. Does not ensure the fastest possible standstill of the system, but maintains all specified dynamic limits
member.remarks:
Cancels the execution of the current Job controlled and inserts a compensation movement for deceleration.
After the slsc_ctrl_stop_controlled call the RTC6 board is still processing already loaded RTC6 micro vector commands in its list memory.
Therefore, it may take up to 30 s until the actual Job execution end.
Afterwards the compensation movement for deceleration is executed.
During this entire time, slsc_ctrl_get_exec_state returns slsc_ExecState_Executing.
After the compensation movement, the syncAXIS control instance operation status changes to red.
The syncAXIS control instance must be initialized again.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcCalibrationLibrary.PointsCloudCalibration(System.Numerics.Vector3[],System.String,System.String,System.String,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.slcl_error_codes@)
member.summary: Recalculates a 3D-Correction file for a user-defined free-form target surface that is defined by a points cloud.
member.remarks: The target surface must be provided as a reference point, a direction vector, and a radius. The reference point is a point on the cylinder mantle and represents the new coordinate origin of the target surface. In the cylinder cross-section it is the point with the largest Z-coordinate. The given direction is the direction of the cylinder axis, which will represent the X-coordinate in the new coordinate system. The new Y-coordinate is the arc length distance on the cylinder mantle from the axis parallel to the cylinder direction going through the reference point.
member.param: README file of source(input) correction file (ctbName_ReadMe.txt or ct5Name_ct5_ReadMe.txt)

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcCalibrationLibrary.CylinderCalibration(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Single,System.String,System.String,System.String,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.slcl_error_codes@)
member.summary:
(Experimental) Recalculates a 3D-Correction file for a user-defined cylindrical target surface that can be shifted, tilted, and rotated.
Y+ | | .............Reference........... | . . . . | . . . . | . . . . ---> Direction | . . . . | . . . . | ................................. | +---------------------------------------------- X+ / / / / Z+
The target surface must be provided as a reference point, a direction vector, and a radius. The reference point is a point on the cylinder mantle and represents the new coordinate origin of the target surface. In the cylinder cross-section it is the point with the largest Z-coordinate. The given direction is the direction of the cylinder axis, which will represent the X-coordinate in the new coordinate system. The new Y-coordinate is the arc length distance on the cylinder mantle from the axis parallel to the cylinder direction going through the reference point. The new file should not be used for points outside the provided target surface.
member.param: README file of source(input) correction file (ctbName_ReadMe.txt or ct5Name_ct5_ReadMe.txt)

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcCalibrationLibrary.ConeCalibration(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.String,System.String,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.slcl_error_codes@)
member.summary:
(Experimental) Recalculates a 3D-Correction file for a user-defined cone target surface that can be shifted, tilted, and rotated.
Y+ | | . | . . . | . . . | . . . ---> Direction | . . . | . . . | . | +---------------------------------------------- X+ / / / / Z+
The target surface must be provided as a reference point, a direction vector, the radius at the reference point and the inclination angle of the cone. The reference point is a point on the lateral surface of the cone and represents the new coordinate origin of the target surface. In the cross-section of the cone that is perpendicular to the direction of the cone it is the point with the largest Z-coordinate. The given direction is the direction of the cone axis, which will represent the X-coordinate in the new coordinate system. The new Y-coordinate is the angular offset from the surface line going through the reference point multiplied by the radius of the cone at the reference point. This means that the same y-coordinate describes a shorter distance at a more narrow part of the cone and a larger distance at a wider part of the cone. The inclination angle is provided in radians and must positive if the cone widens for larger values of X, and negative if it becomes more narrow.
member.param: Radius of the cone at the reference point (mm)
README file of source(input) correction file (ctbName_ReadMe.txt or ct5Name_ct5_ReadMe.txt)

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcCalibrationLibrary.PlaneCalibration(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.String,System.String,System.String,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.slcl_error_codes@)
member.summary:
(Experimental) Recalculates a 3D-Correction table for a new user-defined target plane that may be shifted, tilted, and rotated.
Y+ | | | Normal | . | /|\ | | | /-----------|--------------/ | / . / | / / +------/........................../---------- X+ / /__________________________/ / / / Z+
member.remarks: The new target plane must be provided in parameter form with a reference point and two direction vectors. The reference point represents the new origin of the target plane, while the direction vectors represent the new X- and Y- directions in the target plane. The direction vectors must be perpendicular. Depending on how much shifted and tilted the new target plane is compared to the original target plane, the Correction file may not be useful anymore for 3d-points that are not in the target plane. This cannot be remedied through further 3d-correction.
member.param: X direction of the target plane
Y direction of the target plane
README file of source(input) correction file (ctbName_ReadMe.txt or ct5Name_ct5_ReadMe.txt)

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcCorrection2D
member.summary:
RtcCorrection2D
Configure related program path at first: Config.CorreXionProProgramPath
member.remarks:
The deflection of a laser beam with a two-mirror system results in three effects
(1) The arrangement of the mirrors leads to a certain distortion of the Image field (1)
(2) The distance in the Image field is not proportional to the scan angle itself, but to the tangent of the scan angle. Therefore, the mark speed of the laser focus in the Image field is not proportional to the angular velocity of the corresponding galvanometer scanner.
(3) If an ordinary lens is used for focusing the laser beam, the focus lies on a sphere. In a flat Image field plane, a varying spot size results.
By focusing the deflected laser beam with an F-Theta objective, effect 2 and effect 3 can be avoided.
However, this causes a barrel-shaped distortion of the Image field, see Figure 57.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcSignalLevel
member.summary:
RTC output signal (LASER 1,2 and LASER ON) levels
Above RTC5

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.ListType.Single
member.summary:
Single list buffered.
RTC4: max 8000 buffer size
RTC5: max 2^20 buffer size
RTC6: max 2^23 buffer size
member.remarks:
List commands are executed when ListExecute has called.
Use buffer as giant single memory. so there is a limitation of data counts.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.ListType.Auto
member.summary:
Double list buffered.
Buffers are executed automatically and exchanged if full enough
member.remarks:
List commands are executed when buffer if full enough.
Use 2 buffers for swap each other. so there is no limitation of data counts.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserMode
member.summary:
RTC Laser Modes
Timing of LASER1, LASER2, LASERON pin-out signals

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserMode.Co2
member.summary:
CO2
LASERON: On
LASER1: Q Switch Frequency and Pulse Width [with Pulse Completion]
LASER2: Standby Frequency and Pulse Width with Phase Shift

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserMode.Yag1
member.summary:
YAG1
LASERON: On
LASER1: Q Switch Frequency and Pulse Width + Standby Frequency (LASERON is not overlapped)
LASER2: FPK (Q Switch is overlapped)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserMode.Yag2
member.summary:
YAG2
LASERON: On
LASER1: Q Switch Frequency and Pulse Width + Standby Frequency (LASERON is not overlapped)
LASER2: FPK (Q Switch is not overlapped)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserMode.Yag3
member.summary:
YAG3
LASERON: On
LASER1: Q Switch Frequency and Pulse Width with Pulse Completion + Standby Frequency (LASERON is not overlapped)
LASER2: FPK (Delayed 10 usec and overlapped with Q Switch)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserMode.Mode4
member.summary:
MODE4
LASERON: On
LASER1: Standby Frequency and Pulse Width
LASER2: FPK (Standby Frequency is overlapped)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserMode.Yag5
member.summary:
YAG5
LASERON: On
LASER1: Q Switch Frequency and Pulse Width (Configurable Q Switch delay and with Pulse Completion) + + Standby Frequency (LASERON is not overlapped
LASER2: FPK (Q Switch is overlapped)
above RTC5

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.LaserMode.Mode6
member.summary:
MODE6
LASERON: On with Pulse Completion
LASER1: Standby Frequency and Pulse Width
LASER2: FPK (Stanby Frequency is overlapped)
above RTC5

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc3D.IsDirectMode3D
member.remarks:
If Disabled, the z output is changed to its end-value in such a way that the focus is kept in one plane during the entire jump.
If Enabled, The z output is changed directly (linearly) to its end value during a jump.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam
member.summary:
Correction File Header Infomation
above RTC5 (.ct5)

summary.remarks:
For a configuration with a scan objective: the effective focal length of the objective [mm].
For a configuration without a scan objective: the working distance A [mm].
A = distance from the optical axis of the incident laser beam at the first deflection mirror to the image plane.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.StretchFactorX
member.summary:
Stretch factor for the x direction.
Compensates the pyramid-shaped image field change which exists in the z direction of 3D markings.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.StretchFactorY
member.summary:
Stretch factor for the y direction.
Compensates the pyramid-shaped image field change which exists in the z direction of 3D markings.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.CoefficientA
member.summary: Bits ! Coefficient A of the polynomial for z axis control, offset part, 26 Bit.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.CoefficientB
member.summary: Bits ! Coefficient B of the polynomial for z axis control, linear part, 11 Bit.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.CoefficientC
member.summary: Bits ! Coefficient C of the polynomial for z axis control, square part, 4 Bit.

summary.para:
Number of the correction file.
With correction files supplied by SCANLAB, the parameter corresponds to the number in the file name
(for example, 145 for D2_145.ct5 or D3_145.ct5)

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.DifferentiationFThetaObjective
member.summary:
Differentiation between correction with or without an F-Theta objective.
The following applies:
Parameter = 10 * PObj + PTyp with
PObj = 0: Correction without F-Theta objective
PObj = 1: Correction with F-Theta objective
if correction with F-Theta objective:
PTyp = 0.0: without distortion data
PTyp = 1.0: with F-Thetas F-stop progression condition
PTyp = 2.0: with image height table

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.IndicatorFortheSourceOfTheCorrectionFile
member.summary:
Indicator for the source of the correction file.
The following applies: Parameter = 1000 * POrig + PVer with
POrig = 10000: Originally calculated file
POrig = 20000: converted from ctb file
POrig = 30000: reconstructed from txt file
By manipulating a correction file using correction programs available from SCANLAB, POrig is increased by 1 in each case.
PVer = Version number of the program used to create the correction file

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.InverseTable
member.summary:
Information about the inverse table.
The following applies: Parameter = PExist + 2 PCalc with
PExist = 1.0: valid inverse table is present
PExist = 0.0: no valid inverse table present
If valid inverse table is present:
PCalc = 0: inverse table calculated ab initio
PCalc = 1: inverse table numerically calculated

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.AngleCalibration
member.summary:
Angle calibration of the scan system.
Mechanical angle deflection in [ ] at 96% of the maximum control.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.ScanHeadGeometry
member.summary:
Code for the scan head geometry used for the calculation (for internal use only), for example,
= 1.0: unknown geometry (for example, for a table converted from a ctb file)
= 0.0: standard geometry

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.ProtectiveWindow
member.summary:
Indicator for whether an additional protective window has been taken into account.
The following applies: Parameter = 1,000,000 PT + 1,000 PI with
PT = Protective window thickness in mm (max. 2 decimal places)
PI = Refraction index(max. 3 decimal places)
Example: The value 3,521,450.0 corresponds to a protective window thickness of 3.52 mm and a refraction index of 1.450.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CorrectionFileHeaderParam.ImageFieldSizeLimited
member.summary:
Indicator for whether the image field size has been limited in the correction file.
= 0.0: without field size limit
= 2.0: with field size limit

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcJumpMode
member.remarks:
For scan systems equipped with one or several Jump tunings, you can also activate Jump Mode(and hereby tuning autoswitching) for 2D jumps.
The default set start behavior is that the scan system starts with tuning number 0 upon power-up or after a reset.
Vector(default) jump mode :
The jump length gets subdivided into individually executable Microsteps in accordance with the current jump speed.
If the scan system is only equipped with a Jump tuning, then the Microsteps execute using this tuning.
A Jump Delay defined by set_scanner_delays is executed before a subsequent list command.
Hard jump mode :
The entire jump length of the 2D jump is controlled as a Hard jump over a time dimensioned jump of 10 duration.The target position is executed without Microstepping.
At the end of the 2D jump, the RTC5/6 PCI Board automatically switches to a Vector tuning(if the scan system is equipped with one and if a corresponding setting has been made by set_jump_mode)

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.RtcJumpMode.LimitLength
member.remarks:
At the end of the 2D jump, a jump-length dependent Jump Delay occurs.
This Jump Delay can be specified for the corresponding jump length by load_jump_table_offset or set_jump_table.
CtlDelay is not taken into account.

member.remarks: Enabling is only possible if a jump-tuning-equipped intelliSCAN (with scan system firmware version >= 2078) is attached to at least one of the two scan head connectors.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcJumpMode.ListJumpHard(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Double,System.Double)
member.remarks:
Moves the output point (of the laser focus) by a Hard jump (without split-up into Microsteps) directly from the current position to the specified position(absolute coordinate values) within a 2D Image field.
By LasOn >= 0 and LasOff >= 0, you can set a new LaserOn Delay or LaserOff Delay for each individual Microvector. Each delay thereby gets set at the end of the clock cycle in which the new position actually gets outputted(this output clock cycle is delayed by a preceding scanner delay).
Negative values (LasOn < 0 and LasOff < 0) do not affect Laser Delays. Hereby, the laser can remain on or off across multiple clock cycles (mark and jump simulation).

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcJumpMode.ListJumpHard(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Double,System.Double)
member.remarks:
Moves the output point (of the laser focus) by a Hard jump (without split-up into Microsteps) directly from the current position to the specified position(absolute coordinate values) within a 2D Image field.
By LasOn >= 0 and LasOff >= 0, you can set a new LaserOn Delay or LaserOff Delay for each individual Microvector. Each delay thereby gets set at the end of the clock cycle in which the new position actually gets outputted(this output clock cycle is delayed by a preceding scanner delay).
Negative values (LasOn < 0 and LasOff < 0) do not affect Laser Delays. Hereby, the laser can remain on or off across multiple clock cycles (mark and jump simulation).

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcMoF.CtlMofTrackingError(System.Double,System.Double)
member.remarks:
EC = E + (E EP) * TrackingError
E is the current encoder value.
EP is that of the previous cycle.d
EC is the compensated encoder value(used for Processing-on-the-fly correction).
To avoid step-like galvanometer scanner movements, the used encoders should have a sufficiently high resolution (counts per 10 s cycle)

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtcMoF.ListMofAngularBegin(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
List MoF angular begin
Scanner movements affected by accumulate encoder values
var rtcMoF = rtc as IRtcMoF; rtcMoF.EncCountsPerRevolution = 3600; // Encoder counts/revolution ... rtcMoF.CtlMofEncoderReset(); rtc.ListBegin(); var rotateCenter = new Vector2(-50, 0); rtcMoF.ListMotfAngularBegin(rotateCenter); rtc.ListJumpTo(new Vector2(0, 0)); rtcMoF.ListMotfAngularWait(0, EncoderWaitCondition.Over); // Wait until rotation has over 0 degree rtc.ListJumpTo(-rotateCenter + new Vector2(10, 0)); // Draw circle with radius: 10 rtc.ListArcTo(-rotateCenter, 360.0f); rtcMoF.ListMotfAngularWait(180, EncoderWaitCondition.Over); // Wait until rotation has over 180 degree rtc.ListJumpTo(rotateCenter + rotateCenter + new Vector2(10, 0)); // Draw circle with radius: 10 rtc.ListArcTo(rotateCenter + rotateCenter, 360.0f); rtcMoF.ListMofEnd(Vector2.Zero); rtc.ListEnd(); rtc.ListExecute(true);
For example, rotate center at -50, 0
| | | | | | | | | |--------|--------| | | | | | | | | | | | | --------------------- Rotate+Center -------------- Scanner ----| 0, 0 | 50, 0 | | | | | | | | | | |--------|--------| | . | . | . | . | . | . | / . | --- ClockWise = Angle+ = Enc+ | \

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SkyWritingMode.Mode1
member.remarks:
In the run-in phase, the vector/arc is preceded by a forerun movement performed by the galvanometer scanners at mark speed,
After the vector/arc has been processed at mark speed, it is gets a short deceleration and retrace movement of the galvanometer scanners (at mark speed) appended in the run-out phase.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SkyWritingMode.Mode2
member.remarks:
Each to-be-executed vector/arc gets preceded and appended with a run-in motion and a run-out motion in extension of the vector/arc at mark speed.
Within a Sky Writing Mode 2 marking sequence, however, neither forerun motions (in the run-in phase) nor retrace motions (in the run-out phase) of the galvanometer scanners occur.
Instead, the RTC5/6 Board executes Sky Writing jumps (at the currently specified jump speed) from jump vector startpoints to run-in startpoints, from run-out endpoints to run-in startpoints, and from run-out endpoints to jump vector endpoints.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.SkyWritingMode.Mode3
member.remarks:
The time cost of Sky Writing motions for vectors and arcs having only small directional changes within a Polyline is probably disproportionately high for the gained accuracy.
Only for larger angle deviations (Cos() < Limit) between successive Mark commands of a Polyline a Sky Writing motions is executed as in SkyWriting Mode2.
